result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio M Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Probation review hearing October 23, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
*10/23/2015  Court found that further view is not needed.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*10/23/2015 Court modified the No Contact Order to a No Violent contact Order.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
Complete parenting class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: *8/21/2015** Order for Commitment signed. To serve seven (7) days, straight time. Forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio M Wright

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error/typo, 7 days condition time now showing 8/21/15 (previous typo was 8/21/16).
Per auditing file, JOC amended to reflect the Court dates of 8/21/15 and 10/23/15.
Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 7 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Lisa G.

  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Complete parenting class.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Victim Impact Statement, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court modifed the no contact order to allow the defendant to pick up the children and drop them off at the residence.  No direct contact with the victim.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status conference held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/08/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defendant has a new case.  Defense may want to adjourn the jury trial as he has not been able to meet with his client.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-09-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 2/9/15 at 8:30am, Branch 40.vb

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lizzie W. or Lisa G.

Defendant Antonio M Wright in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Defendant Antonio M Wright in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
